meanings.sent1: In the race, Sarah trumps all her friends with her speed.
meanings.sent2: Hard work trumps talent when it comes to success.
meanings.sent3: Tom's ability to run trumps his fear of losing.
meanings.sent4: The sun trumps the moon in brightness.
meanings.sent5: Practice trumps natural ability in the long run.

meanings.sent1: Having a positive attitude is a real trumps in life.
meanings.sent2: Education is often seen as a trumps for a better future.
meanings.sent3: His sense of humor is his biggest trumps in making friends.
meanings.sent4: Kindness is a trumps that can open many doors.
meanings.sent5: Time management is a trumps in achieving success.

meanings.definition: A playing card of a suit that outranks all others
meanings.sent1: In the game, the ace of spades trumps all other cards.
meanings.sent2: Remember, a trump can change the course of the game.
meanings.sent3: She played her trump card at just the right moment.
meanings.sent4: The king of hearts is a powerful trump in this round.
meanings.sent5: Knowing when to play your trump is key to winning.

meanings.definition: To produce a sound by expelling air through pursed lips
meanings.sent1: He trumps to call his dog over.
meanings.sent2: The children love to trump to make funny noises.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to trump for a comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: She can trump like a trumpet player with her mouth.
meanings.sent5: When excited, he tends to trump instead of speaking.
